name: set_ss7_node
description: This request is used to configure the SS7 settings for various equipment (ex: YateHSS/HLR,YateSMSC, YateUCN etc.).

requests.node: The node for which SS7 settings are configured. Ex: hss

params.comment__local: Information about the local node (the actual equipment that you are configuring). . The information about the local node is organized in 'common' object (common settings for the network, but also equipment specific information).

common.pointcode: Local pointcode, integer representation, range depends on dialect.
common.gt: Array of local GT. The first element is the GT we are sending from.
common.hlr: Optional, HLR number (GT) returned in Update Location.
common.msisdn: Array of MSISDN prefixes to which the HLR will respond.
common.ip: Local IP address for signaling protocols. Array or comma separated list.
common.sccp_tt: Boolean. Optional, use Translation Type in SCCP messages, defaults to false.
common.sccp_pc: Boolean. Optional, use Point Code in SCCP source address, defaults to false.

params.comment__linksets: Configures the linksets and links to the STP

linksets.comment__type: For M3UA pointcode is optional. Either pointcode and/or route must be present
linksets.pointcode: Adjacent point code, integer representation, range depends on dialect
linksets.route: Optional array of PCs in integer representation to route through this STP. The string 'default' may be used as point code to indicate a default route. E.g. route: [23, 'default']
linksets.comment__links: M2PA: list of links. M3UA: 1 entry with connection data

links.ip: Remote IP address. Array or comma separated list.
links.port: Integer: 1-65535. Port on the adjacent node.
links.local_ip: Array of Optional local IP address (use common if missing).
links.local_port: Optional. Integer: 1-65535. Local port number. Ignored for M3UA. Otherwise: use remote port as default if missing.
links.comment__sctp_params: Optional SCTP params. All params are optional. All integer params are unsigned. See lksctp.conf for info.

sctp_params.rto_initial: Initial Retransmission Timeout. Format: NNN. Numeric value, maximum 3 digits.
sctp_params.rto_min: Minimum Retransmission Timeout. Format: NNN. Numeric value, maximum 3 digits.
sctp_params.rto_max: Maximum Retransmission Timeout. Format: NNN. Numeric value, maximum 3 digits.
sctp_params.max_retrans: Maximum number of retransmissions. Format: NNN. Numeric value, maximum 3 digits.
sctp_params.hb_interval: Heartbeat interval in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 for Diameter transport.
sctp_params.hb_enabled: Boolean. Enable Heartbeat. Defaults to true.
sctp_params.sack_delay: Selective Acknowledgement delay. Between 0 and 500ms. Format: NNN. Numeric value, maximum 3 digits.
sctp_params.sack_freq: Selective Acknowledgement frequency. Format: NNN. Numeric value, maximum 3 digits.

linksets.aspid: M3UA only. Number. Optional ASP identifier (unsigned 32 bit)
linksets.contexts: M3UA only. Number. Optional Array of  routing context numbers (unsigned 32 bit)
linksets.traffic: M3UA only. String. Optional traffic type. Possible values: unused/override/loadshare/broadcast
linksets.network_appearance: M3UA only. Number. Optional network appearance (unsigned 32 bit)

gt_route.pc: Number. Remote point code (must a configured one if there is no default route)
gt_route.prefix: Number. List of GT prefixes to route to this PC, can be just [ '*' ]

errors.message: Missing all parameters./ Missing 'linkset type' parameter.
Locked config file 'conf_file_name'. / Failed to save config file 'conf_file_name'. / One or more of the config files is locked.

name: set_diam_node
description: This request is used to configure the diameter settings for various equipment (ex: YateHSS/HLR, YateUCN etc.).

params.comment__local: Information about the local node (the actual equipment that you are configuring). The information about the local node is organized in 'common' object (settings for the network, but also equipment specific information).

common.relay_route_priority: Number. Optional default route priority for remote nodes advertising. Relay application. Negative: disable. Defaults to 100.

identities.role: String. Optional name of special role of this node
identities.default_priority: Number. Optional priority to use this node if no other matches. Default 0 (disabled).
identities.default_realm_priority: Number. Optional priority to use this node if only realm matches. Default 0 (disabled).

listeners.local_ip: Array of Local IP to bind to.
listeners.local_port: Optional local port number, protocol default port will be used if missing
listeners.ipv6only: Boolean. Optional. Accept IPv6 only connections. Ignored if local_ip is IPv4

sctp_params.rto_initial: Number. Unsigned. Optional. See lksctp.conf for info.
sctp_params.rto_min: Number. Unsigned. Optional. See lksctp.conf for info.
sctp_params.rto_max: Number. Unsigned. Optional. See lksctp.conf for info.
sctp_params.max_retrans: Number. Unsigned. Optional. See lksctp.conf for info.
sctp_params.hb_interval: Number. Unsigned. Optional. See lksctp.conf for info.
sctp_params.sack_delay: Number. Unsigned. Optional. See lksctp.conf for info.
sctp_params.sack_freq: Number. Unsigned. Optional. See lksctp.conf for info.

listeners.comment_accept: Optional, configure accept rule(s). If present and not empty it will restrict the list of local nodes. Handled by this listener. All identities will be handled by this listener if accept is empty

accept.node: Node to accept, must be a configured identity
accept.accept_node: Optional remote node(s) to accept. String: RegExp to match node(s) to accept / Array: Only remote nodes matching it will be accepted. If present and not empty only listed remote nodes will be accepted.
accept.default_route: Number. Optional default route priority for accepted connections

params.comment__connections: Information about the local node (the actual YateHSS/HLR server that you are configuring). The information about the local node is organized in 'common' object (settings for the network, but also equipment specific information).

connections.node: Local identity. The name of a node configured in identities.
connections.remote_host: Diameter remote (peer) host name. Ex: FQDN
connections.ip: Optional Array of IP address to connect to. Remote host will be used if missing.
connections.port: Optional port to connect to. Protocol default will be used if missing
connections.local_ip: Optional Array of local IP to bind on
connections.comment__sctp_params: Optional SCTP params. All params are optional. All integer params are unsigned. See lksctp.conf for info

errors.message: No connection or listener configured. / Invalid 'accept node' param value 'provided_value' - not configured.

name: set_regexroute
description: This request is used to configure the regexroute settings for various equipment (ex: YateHSS/HLR, YateUCN etc.).

rules.name: string, optional. Name of template used for adding comments in the written file to make reading easier.
rules.rules: string, mandatory. Contains rules that are to be written for this template in regexroute.  The string must be in valid Yate configuration format.

responses.api_version: Version of the package containing the API. In case the API version is unavailable the returned value is 'unknown'.

errors.message: Invalid 'rules' value - Must be an array.

name: set_javascript
description: This request is used to configure the javascript scripts for various equipment (ex: YateHSS/HLR, YateUCN etc.).

scripts.name: string, optional. Name of script used for adding comments in the written file to make reading easier.
scripts.rules: string, mandatory. Contains rules that are to be written for this template in regexroute.  The string must be in valid Yate configuration format.
scripts.script: string, mandatory. Contains the JS script that will be written for this template in javascript.  The string must be in valid Yate configuration format.

errors.message: Invalid 'scripts' value - Must be an array.

name: get_api_version
description: Retrieve the version of the API

responses.api_version: Version of the package containing the API. In case the API version is unavailable the returned value is 'unknown'.

name: get_oem_serial
description: Retrieve the OEM serial number of the machine

responses.serial: OEM serial string. In case the OEM file is present but the number is missing will return 'serial':null.

name: get_net_address
description: Retrieves a list of network interface information from the equipment.

params.filtered: Boolean. If true removes loopback and PGW tunnels created by Yate. (optional, default true).

net_address.ethernet: Ethernet MAC address, only if applicable
net_address.vlan: Numeric VLAN ID, only if applicable
net_address.mtu: Numeric Maximum Transfer Unit of the interface

ipv4.alias: Name of this alias, only if applicable

ipv6.prefixlen: Numeric IPv6 network prefix length, usually 64

examples.description: Example having loopback and PGW tunnel removed from response.

name: get_node_type
description: Get a list of all installed node types with their versions

examples.description: Retrieve installed node type and software version.

name: get_node_status
description: Retrieves operational status and software version of the node.

requests.node: Type of node to request status from

responses.operational: Boolean operational status of the node
responses.level: Symbolic reporting level for the current state
responses.state: Short description of the node state
responses.service: Longer, multiline description of the node service state

errors.message: Cannot connect to Yate on port 'NNNN'.

examples.description: Retrieve filtered logs for hss of level 'note'.

name: get_node_logs
description: Retrieve filtered logs of a node since the last start

requests.node: Type of node to retrieve logs from

params.lines: Number of lines to retrieve (optional, default 50)

responses.HTTP Body: Filtered log lines of the node

examples.description: Retrieve filtered logs for hss of level 'note'.

response.HTTP Body: Filtered log lines of the node

name: get_node_config
description: Retrieve a configuraion file or an archive of all config files of a node

requests.node: Type of node to retrieve configs from
Type of node to retrieve configs from

params.file: Name of the config file to retrieve

responses.HTTP Body: Archive of type tar.gz of config files in the node config directory

examples.description: Retrieve archive of all config files for hss.

response.HTTP Body: Archive of type tar.gz of config files in the node config directory

examples.description: Retrieve yate-hss.conf configuraion file for hss.

name: node_restart
description: Restarts the specified node of the equipment at the Operating System service level.

name: node_reload
description: Reload the configuration of a running node

examples.description: Reload the configuration for hss node.

name: query_stats
description: Retrieve statistics from a running node

uptime.wall: Number of seconds since the engine started
uptime.user: Number of CPU seconds consumed in userspace code
uptime.kernel: Number of CPU seconds consumed in kernel code

errors.message: Cannot connect to Yate on port 'NNNN'.

name: info
description: Retrieve a list of API requests with their description

requests.node: Type of node to retrieve APIs from

responses.api_version: Version of the package containing the API

examples.description: Retrieve common requests list, response truncated for brevity

descriptions.info: Retrieve a list of API requests with their description
descriptions.get_api_version: Retrieve the version of the API
descriptions.get_oem_serial: Retrieve the OEM serial number of the machine

name: info_all
description: Retrieve a list of API requests with their detailed description

requests.node: Type of the node to retrieve the full list of APIs from

api_info.api_version: Version of the package containing the API

examples.description: Retrieve list of common API requests with their detailed description

requests.description: Get a list of all installed node types with their versions
